business.headline: GST Council Meet today: Insurance tax to online gaming review—what to expectGST Council Meeting: The session is expected to address several critical topics, including the taxation of insurance premiums, proposed rate rationalisations, and more.

Should you apply for Bajaj Housing Finance IPO? Check GMP, expected gainsBajaj Housing Finance IPO: Investors are anticipating strong listing gains, as indicated by the company's grey market premium (GMP).

Sensex, Nifty open lower as weak US jobs data reignites recession fearsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 181.90 points at 81,002 at 9:19 am, while the NSE NIfty50 declined 49.55 points to trade at 24,802.60.

Maximising returns: How to select top mutual funds for your portfolioMutual funds have emerged as a popular investment option, offering a balanced approach to growing wealth without the complexity of managing individual stocks.

'Multiple call recordings exist': Byju's cries foul after auditor BDO resignsIn a strong response to BDO's resignation, Byju's has accused the audit firm of making unethical requests and manipulating the audit process, including suggesting the backdating of financial reports.

Byju's crisis worsens as second auditor BDO resigns over financial concernsBDO's exit comes just a year after Deloitte, the company's previous auditor, stepped down citing problems with Byju's financial reporting.
Payment aggregators may face 18% GST for transactions up to Rs 2,000: ReportThe final decision will be made at the GST Council's 54th meeting, chaired by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman.

US adds 1,42,000 jobs in August; unemployment rate drops to 4.2%While the job data fell short of expectations, a slight dip in the unemployment rate to 4.2% indicated that the labour market is gradually cooling off, but not dramatically.

IPO investors are not looking beyond listing gains, are they missing out?According to a Sebi study, 70% of the shares, by value, were sold within a year of the IPO. The quick turnover is particularly noticeable in cases where IPO shares see a strong rise in value right after listing.

Anant Ambani donates 20 kg gold crown worth Rs 15 crore to Lalbaugcha RajaLalbaugcha Raja, Mumbai's most popular Ganesh idol, was unveiled on Thursday ahead of Ganesh Chaturthi. Devotees visit the Lalbaugcha Raja for darshan during the 10-day Ganesh festival.

Explained: Why Godfrey Phillips shares hit record high despite market downturnAt the closing bell, the shares of Godfrey Phillips were up 12.69% at Rs 7,204.35 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). Earlier, the stock jumped 14.50% to reach a record high of Rs 7,320, defying a sharp correction in the domestic indices.

Tata Motors shares decline for 6th straight day. Is it a good time to buy?Tata Motors stock settled over 1.8% lower on Friday, extending losses for the sixth consecutive session. Read on to know whether it is the right time to buy the stock.

Sensex crashes 1,000 points, Nifty slips under 24,900 on US data jittersThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 1017.23 points to close at 81,183.93, while the NSE Nifty50 ended 292.95 points lower to end at 24,852.15.
Godfrey Phillips set to consider 2:1 bonus issue; shares jump over 9%A bonus issue is a way for companies to reward existing shareholders without making them pay for the additional shares.

Sensex crashes 1,000 points, investors lose Rs 5 lakh croreThe bloodbath on Dalal Street has wiped off nearly Rs 5 lakh crore from the market capitalisation of all listed companies on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

Government may slash petrol, diesel prices as global crude oil rates fallUS crude oil prices dropped by more than 1% on Wednesday, falling below $70 per barrel. Brent crude prices followed suit, falling by $1 to reach $72.75 per barrel.
Bina Modi to vote on behalf of family trust at Godfrey Phillips AGMThe Delhi High Court recently allowed Bina to cast her vote on behalf of the trust, which holds a 47.5% stake in the company.

Goldman Sachs gives SBI 'sell' rating with revised target price. Know whyThe brokerage highlighted a growing risk-reward imbalance for SBI's stock, driven by challenges in maintaining a strong return on assets.

India's household food spending dips to less than 50%: ReportThe change in spending, highlighted in a recent report by the Economic Advisory Council to the Prime Minister (EAC-PM), signals a shift in how Indian families allocate their monthly budgets.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Rahul Gandhi, in US, says fear of BJP vanished after 2024 Lok Sabha pollsCongress leader Rahul Gandhi, who is on a visit to the US, said the people lost their fear of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP following the 2024 Lok Sabha election results.

Supreme Court hears Kolkata doctor rape-murder case, CBI to file status reportThe Centre has approached the Supreme Court against the West Bengal government's alleged failure to provide basic facilities for the CISF at Kolkata's RG Kar Medical College and Hospital.

Bharat Jodo Yatra was an attack on myself: Rahul Gandhi talks spirituality in USIn a unique blend of spirituality and politics, Congress MP Rahul Gandhi reflected on the importance of self-reflection and the power of love in politics during a recent address to students at the University of Texas in Dallas.

Train hits LPG cylinder on rail tracks in Kanpur, cops hint at sabotageThe Kanpur Police claimed that an attempt was made to derail the Kalindi Express by placing an LPG cylinder on the tracks. A bottle of petrol and matchboxes were also recovered from the spot.
Blame that carb-rich diet for your mood swings A diet high in simple carbs raises blood glucose quickly but also causes a rapid drop, cutting off fuel to the brain and leading to a "sugar crash".

Rahul Gandhi is no Pappu: Congress's Sam Pitroda's praise at Texas eventCongress leader Sam Pitroda has said his party MP and Leader of Opposition in Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi has a vision contrary to what BJP promotes and that he is not a "pappu," as he was often mocked. Pitroda addressed the Indian diaspora in Texas where Rahul Gandhi is visiting. "He (Rahul Gandhi) has a vision contrary to what BJP promotes by spending crores of rupees. I must tell you, he is no Pappu. He is highly educated, well-read, a strategist with deep thinking on any subject and sometimes it is not very easy to understand him," Pitroda said.

'Khaa Maa Kasam': Rishabh Pant's hilarious banter with Kuldeep in Duleep TrophyIndia wicketkeeper batter Rishabh Pant was involved in a hilarious banter with Kuldeep Yadav on Day 4 of the Duleep Trophy clash between India A and India B.

Kolkata doctor's family accuses police of cover-up: Why suppress evidence?The family of the trainee doctor, who was raped and murdered in Kolkata's RG Kar hospital, alleged that the police were making repeated attempts to suppress evidence.

Video: Kamala Harris's campaign gets Bollywood twist with 'Nacho Nacho' songThe Bollywood-inspired campaign song, 'Nacho Nacho', for Kamala Harris is aimed at energising South Asian voters in critical battleground states and building support for the Indian-origin leader.

Sathyabama welcomes the Yorker Champion Jasprit BumrahIn a memorable event, Sathyabama University had the honour of hosting one of India's most celebrated cricket icons, Mr. Jasprit Bumrah. The university's President, Dr. Marie Johnson, and Chancellor, Dr. Mariazeena Johnson, warmly welcomed the champion fast bowler, renowned for his impeccable yorkers, to the campus.

The atmosphere was electric as students gathered in large numbers, eager to catch a glimpse of the cricket sensation. Their excitement and enthusiasm were palpable, reflecting the immense respect and admiration they hold for Bumrah. His visit not only inspired the students but also created an unforgettable experience, further strengthening the bond between sports and academia at Sathyabama University.

Jannik Sinner credits team for US Open win amid doping controversyWorld No.1 Jannik Sinner won the 2024 US Open title after what had been a difficult couple of weeks for him due to the doping controversy. Sinner thanked his team for constant support and said that this title meant a lot to him.

Two terrorists killed as Army foils infiltration attempt in J&K's RajouriThe Army foiled an infiltration attempt at the India-Pakistan border in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri district on Monday, killing two terrorists.

GST Council Meet today: Insurance tax to online gaming review—what to expectGST Council Meeting: The session is expected to address several critical topics, including the taxation of insurance premiums, proposed rate rationalisations, and more.

Stone-throwing at Ganesh pandal in Surat sparks communal tensions, 27 arrestedAt least 27 people were arrested, and six minors were detained by the Surat Police after stones were thrown at a Ganesh pandal in the city. State's Home Minister Harsh Sanghvi and the local BJP MLA also visited the spot and spoke to the locals to reduce the tension in the area.

Rahul Gandhi pins unemployment in India, West on moving production to ChinaDuring an interaction with students at the University of Texas in Dallas on Sunday, Gandhi said there is no shortage of skills in India and the country could compete with China if it starts aligning itself for production.

Protests held in 25 countries over Kolkata rape-murderThe protests started in large and small groups across Japan, Australia, Taiwan and Singapore, before spreading to cities in several European countries. At least 60 were planned in the US alone.

Inspired by Sheetal Devi, 13-year-old fan begins training in her villageA viral video shows a 13-year-old girl from Sheetal Devi's village training in archery under the same coach, despite having no legs and arms. Her determination reflects the inspiring journey of India's Paralympic bronze medalist.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Burnt vehicles, houses, bomb fragments in Manipur amid fresh violenceIn Koutruk in Manipur's Imphal West district where a drone attack occurred, the site resembled a warzone, with footprints of violence visible, including bomb fragments, black and white ashes on the ground, and destroyed vehicles and houses.

Babar Azam greeted with loud cheers from fans before Champions Cup Babar Azam got a rousing reception from fans at the Iqbal Stadium in Faisalabad before the Champions One-Day Cup. Babar recently had a poor outing after Pakistan lost to Bangladesh in the 2-match Test series.

Watch: Salman Khan dances with family during Ganpati 'visarjan'In a viral video, Salman Khan danced with his family during the Ganpati 'visarjan'. The actor's sister, Arpita Khan, and brother-in-law, Aayush Sharma, hosted Ganesh Chaturthi celebrations at their home on September 8.

Case against Sandip Ghosh's aides for threatening junior doctorsAt least 46 threat complaints were filed by junior doctors of the Kolkata Medical College against Dr Birupaksha Biswas, Dr Avik De and Dr Ranjit Saha, who were aides of former RG Kar hospital principal Sandip Ghosh.
Kamala Harris recalls long walks with grandfather in India The Democrat statedthat her grandparents' "commitment to public service and fight for a better future" lived in her today.

Join India, we consider you our own unlike Pak: Rajnath Singh to POK residentsUnion Minister Rajnath Singh said that there is a sea change in the overall security situation in Jammu and Kashmir since the abrogation of Article 370 in August 2019.

Stree 2 box office Day 25: Beats Gadar 2, now 4th biggest Bollywood film ever Stree 2 set the cash registers ringing at the box office even in its fourth weekend. The horror-comedy has now emerged as the fourth highest-grossing Bollywood film of all time in India by surpassing Sunny Deol's Gadar 2.

Rajinikanth congratulates actor Vigneshkanth for his 50-hour podcast on himActor RJ Vigneshkanth conducted a 50-hour non-stop live podcast on Rajinikanth and won the Guinness World Record. Thalaivar sent a voice note expressing his love to him and his team.

Shilpa Shetty praises husband Raj Kundra's Bhangra moves in adorable birthday postActor Shilpa Shetty wished her businessman husband Raj Kundra on his 49th birthday today, September 9. She delighted fans with a video of Raj flaunting his desi moves at a party.

Ankita Lokhande's post for Sanjay Leela Bhansali: Grateful for your mentorship Ankita Lokhande expressed her admiration for filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali with a beautiful post on social media. The actor thanked the director for his 'guidance and mentorship'.

sports.headline: 'Khaa Maa Kasam': Rishabh Pant's hilarious banter with Kuldeep in Duleep TrophyIndia wicketkeeper batter Rishabh Pant was involved in a hilarious banter with Kuldeep Yadav on Day 4 of the Duleep Trophy clash between India A and India B.

Watch: Emotional Jannik Sinner dedicates US Open triumph to ailing auntJannik Sinner's emotional US Open victory became even more meaningful as he dedicated his triumph to his ailing aunt, sharing his joy with her during her challenging health battle, making his win a deeply personal milestone.

Her determination reflects the inspiring journey of India's Paralympic bronze medalist.

ENG vs SL: Josh Hull's 'slingy' action reminds Stuart Broad of Mitchell JohnsonFormer England fast bowler Stuart Broad has said that Josh Hull's action reminds him of Mitchell Johnson. Hull made his debut in the ongoing third Test against Sri Lanka at the Oval.

Jannik Sinner reacts to 'Big 3' absence from Grand Slams: Nice for new championsJannik Sinner's US Open triumph after beating Taylor Fritz solidifies a new era in tennis, marking the first year without a "Big Three" Grand Slam champion, as fresh faces like his and Carlos Alcaraz's redefine the sport's competitive landscape.

American dream crashes after Taylor Fritz, Jessica Pegula lose US Open 2024: Taylor Fritz and Jessica Pegula could not survive the heat in the final after losing to Jannik Sinner and Aryna Sabalenka at the Arthur Ashe Stadium.

ENG vs SL: Jamie Smith's rescue act draws massive Adam Gilchrist comparisonEngland assistant coach Paul Collingwood has drawn a massive Adam Gilchrist comparison for Jamie Smith after his gutsy fifty on Day 3 of the third Test against Sri Lanka.

US Open or Australian Open, which tournament was difficult to win? Sinner revealsJannik Sinner opened up on which tournament was difficult to win out of his two grand slam titles, the Australian Open or the US Open. Sinner beat Taylor Fritz to win the US Open 2024 on Monday, September 9.

Bangladesh aim to use confidence of Pakistan win in India: Shoriful Islam IND vs BAN: Shoriful Islam said that Bangladesh will be look to carry the confidence of their series win against Pakistan to the upcoming Tests against India.

Upset Taylor Fritz apologises after losing US Open final to Jannik SinnerUSA's Taylor Fritz apologised to the fans after losing the US Open final to Jannik Sinner on Sunday. Fritz was blown away by the Italian in straight sets in just 2 hours and 16 minutes.

Babar Azam greeted with loud cheers from fans before Champions Cup Babar Azam got a rousing reception from fans at the Iqbal Stadium in Faisalabad before the Champions One-Day Cup. Babar recently had a poor outing after Pakistan lost to Bangladesh in the 2-match Test series.

Bangladesh aim to use confidence of Pakistan win in India: Shoriful Islam IND vs BAN: Shoriful Islam said that Bangladesh will be look to carry the confidence of their series win against Pakistan to the upcoming Tests against India.

Upset Taylor Fritz apologises after losing US Open final to Jannik SinnerUSA's Taylor Fritz apologised to the fans after losing the US Open final to Jannik Sinner on Sunday. Fritz was blown away by the Italian in straight sets in just 2 hours and 16 minutes.

Sherfane Rutherford pulls out of CPL 2024 for personal reasonsSherfane Rutherford of the St Kitts and Nevis Patriots would not be a part of the remaining CPL 2024 matches after pulling out due to personal reasons.

Cruise ships, hotels: Japan set to ditch Games Village in Asiad 2026Japan are set to ditch the traditional Games Village in the 2026 Asiad, announced Tsunekazu Takeda, former president of the Japan Olympic Committee. The groundbreaking decision has not gone down well ith everyone.

Paralympics closing ceremony: Rainy Paris bids goodbye with sensational DJ partyThe Paris Paralympics came to a close with a stunning DJ party at the Stade de France on Sunday, September 8. A rainy Paris said goodbye to the Paralympians before passing on the baton to LA.

Jannik Sinner credits team for US Open win amid doping controversyWorld No.1 Jannik Sinner won the 2024 US Open title after what had been a difficult couple of weeks for him due to the doping controversy. Sinner thanked his team for constant support and said that this title meant a lot to him.

Watch: Jannik Sinner gets warm hug from Anna Kalinskaya after title win US Open 2024: Jannik Sinner shared a beautiful moment with his girlfriend after he won the men's singles title at the Flushing Meadows with a straight sets win over Taylor Fritz.

Jannik Sinner clinches singles title after hammering Taylor Fritz US Open 2024: World No.1 Jannik Sinner beat Taylor Fritz 6-3, 6-4, 7-5 in the final on Sunday and became the first Italian man to claim the men's singles title at Flushing Meadows.

DPL: East Delhi claim inaugural title with 3-run victory over SouthEast Delhi Riders made history after winning the inaugural edition of Delhi Premier League T20 at the Arun Jaitley Stadium. Mayank Rawat starred in the final and helped East beat South by 3 runs.

AFG vs NZ: Ibrahim Zadran ruled out of one-off Test due to ankle injuryAfghanistan batter Ibrahim Zadran has been ruled out of the one-off Test match vs New Zealand. Zadran hurt his ankle in the practice session before the Test match.

Watch: Jannik Sinner gets warm hug from Anna Kalinskaya after title win US Open 2024: Jannik Sinner shared a beautiful moment with his girlfriend after he won the men's singles title at the Flushing Meadows with a straight sets win over Taylor Fritz.

Jannik Sinner clinches singles title after hammering Taylor Fritz US Open 2024: World No.1 Jannik Sinner beat Taylor Fritz 6-3, 6-4, 7-5 in the final on Sunday and became the first Italian man to claim the men's singles title at Flushing Meadows.

DPL: East Delhi claim inaugural title with 3-run victory over SouthEast Delhi Riders made history after winning the inaugural edition of Delhi Premier League T20 at the Arun Jaitley Stadium. Mayank Rawat starred in the final and helped East beat South by 3 runs.

AFG vs NZ: Ibrahim Zadran ruled out of one-off Test due to ankle injuryAfghanistan batter Ibrahim Zadran has been ruled out of the one-off Test match vs New Zealand. Zadran hurt his ankle in the practice session before the Test match.

Butcher slams complacent England after batting collapse in 3rd TestENG vs SL: Mark Butcher has slammed England for their batting collapse in their second innings of the third Test against Sri Lanka. At Stumps on Day 3, Sri Lanka needed 125 runs to win while chasing 2019.

Shakib Al Hasan joins Surrey for County match before India tour Surrey roped in Bangladesh all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan for the County Championship match against Somerset, which is set to be played from September 9 in Taunton.

ENG vs SL 3rd Test: England's collapse on Day 3 leaves match in balanceThe Oval Test was left in the balance at the end of Day 3 as England's 2nd innings collapse meant that Sri Lanka needed 219 runs to secure the win. Kumara picked up 4 wickets while Nissanka scored another fifty giving the visitors the edge on Sunday.

US Open Men's Singles Final Highlights: Sinner wins singles title after beating Fritz US Open 2024 Men's Singles Final Highlights: World No.1 Jannik Sinner won the men's singles title at Flushing Meadows after beating USA's Taylor Fritz 6-3, 6-4, 7-5 in two hours and 16 minutes.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

WC influential ten: Writers community honors digital social change makersWriters Community Freelancers Releases 'WC Influential Ten' List Recognizing Social Impact through Virtual Space and Social Media
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
